Description: Textile fragments; very large fragmentary painted linen shroud with text excerpts and vignettes from the Book of the Dead, for a man named Amenhotep. One plain selvedge; other edges are misssing, but the textile is almost complete widthways. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.24 ends per 10mm and weft c.16 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1991] Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 116
